scenario_text.value: (It’s been a while since the professor left.)

(The professor sure is taking a long time.
I’m starting to get worried...)

(And I’m worried about us, too.
No one has said a word.)

(Not that I blame them. We’ve been through
a lot in such a short period of time.)
What the heck was that?
Kaito?

I know I saw it. A black fog that came out of
Lopmon’s body when it was hurt by Shuuji.

It must be something bad...
If you ask me.

I know what you mean.
It turned my stomach.

It’s just like that other fog—
No, even worse!

One mistake back there and Shuuji could’ve
been on the brink of death!

I can’t deny that what you’re saying
is a possibility...
I... I just don’t know.

Was it a vision from Archnemon?
No, it can’t be!
Shuuji was eaten by...by Wendimon!

And then Wendimon was swallowed up by those
hands that came out of the fog!
Yeah. He just disappeared like Ryo.

Disappeared? He didn’t just “disappear”!
Shuuji died, just like Ryo did!
I mean...

Dracumon, just what ARE you guys?
What was that THING we saw back there?!

I... I don’t know.
I’ve never seen anything like that before.

You have to know something!
Our lives are on the line here!

(Kaito’s getting worked up...
But I understand where he’s coming from.)

(Everyone’s shaken up.
They don’t know what to believe anymore.)

Hey, Saki? If we don’t do something,
everyone’s going to—
No! Stay away from me!
What? ...Saki?!

That was out of line, Saki.
Floramon’s just worried about you.
Right, Aoi? You think so, too, huh?
Maybe... I guess.
I kind of get where she’s coming from.

Just to be clear, you guys are on our side...
Right?
Of course we are!

“Of course”?
How can you even say that?!
Can you prove you’re truly on our side?!

Doesn’t the fact that I’ve fought at your
side this whole time prove anything to you?

It’s true. You’ve always been there for us.
Like friends...partners, even.

But can we really trust you?
How do we know you aren’t lying?!

For all we know, you’re pretending you’re
worried to trick us later!

Calm down, Minoru! I know you are concerned,
but bullying is not a good look on you!

Excuse me?
You don’t tell me what to do!

What makes you guys so different from
everything we’ve fought so far?!
Allow me to make something clear...

If we hadn’t accompanied you children, you’d
all be long gone.

So what? You’re saying you can just get rid
of us anytime you want to? Is that it?!
Why do you keep assuming the worst about us?

Enough, Minoru. I understand how you feel,
but this is getting us nowhere.

Okay, okay...
I’m sorry, Takuma.

I just don’t know what to do.
Dangit...

(Minoru’s really confused.
I wonder if I can make him feel better.)

(If he can calm down, that might give him
some time to figure out what he wants to do.)

(Or if I can suggest what we should do, that
might make him feel better, too.)
(What does Minoru need to hear...?)
Now’s not the time.
Calm down, you two.
Then don’t believe.

Now’s not the time to think about what to do.
Everyone’s in shock, and tired.
Overthinking it will only lead to trouble.

Rest your body and your mind will feel
better, too.

Yeah, you should see yourself right now!
Don’t get too carried away.

Look who’s talking!
Who’s fault do you think this is, anyway?
Stop it! Why can’t we just get along?

I thought we were partners...
And I’m mad that it could all be a lie!

You’re assuming it’s a lie.
Exactly what the enemy wants you to think!

Could you two please calm down?
We need to focus.

You want me to calm down?!
We might have a traitor on our hands!
He always seemed like a traitor.

Then again, like Falcomon said, he’s fought
with us this whole time.
Agreed. What Falcomon said makes sense.

And, personally speaking, I can’t imagine
Lopmon betraying me.
Thank you, Shuuji...
I hope you’re right...

I would never turn traitor on you, Minoru!
I promise!
You should prove it, then!
No, YOU should quit doubting my loyalty!
No, you should BOTH quit fighting!
Shut up, Miu.
Why? You don’t like what I said?

I agree with Minoru.
I don’t wanna be anywhere near that thing.

You never know when Shakomon is gonna attack
you!

No way!
Shakomon would never do that!
She’s right! I’d never hurt Miu!
Stop fighting, both of you!
Shut up, Miu.
Why? You don’t like what I said?

You wouldn’t say that if you knew what
happened to Ryo.

Shakomon might try to eat you one day, too.
You never know.

How can you say that?! Shakomon would never
do such a terrible thing!
She’s right! I’d never hurt Miu!

If I were you, I’d be thinking about your own
partner instead!

Yeah, Kaito! You were way too mean to
Dracumon!

An apology’s in order!
We’re supposed to be on the same side, here!

Oh, come on!
I said that because I’m worried about you!

(This is bad. I want to stop the fighting,
but it’s only getting worse...)

ENOUGH! This is pointless if you’re just
gonna be stubborn.

Falcomon? Hey!
Where are you going?!

Falcomon, don’t go... With you gone, who
knows what’ll happen!

Can you at least wait until the professor
gets back before deciding? Please?

Yeah, that’s not too much to ask, is it?
C’mon, Falcomon.

All right. I suppose I may have been too
hasty in my distress.

You’re both too worked up over this.
We need to stay calm.
Both of us? Really?
Yes, Falcomon. You need to calm down, too.

What you said crossed the line, Falcomon.
Try to understand where Minoru’s coming from.
What do you mean, exactly?

Everybody’s stressed out just trying to
survive in this confusing world.

Is it really that bad for Minoru to try to
make sure it’s safe around you guys?
Is that to say you doubt us as well?
I mean...
(I’m at a loss for words.)

(I trust Agumon.
We can trust them...I think.)

(Then again, all of this could be one big
trap...)

(It’s not so simple to distinguish between
right and wrong.)

Hmph. It seems as if you humans see us all as
villains!

I’m not saying that! All I’m asking for is
some sympathy for Minoru.

It amounts to the same thing...
Fine.

Falcomon?
Where are you going?
I don’t have time to deal with any of you.
Falcomon!
Let him go. See if I care.

Thanks for having my back, man.
I appreciate it.
Minoru...

We should stop him, Takuma.
It’s not too late yet.
Yeah, you’re right. Let’s go, Agumon.
Hmph.

Come back, Falcomon.
I know you’re mad at Minoru, but still...
Hm. Agumon...

Why do you choose to remain with a human when
they see us as evil?

Because Takuma is special.
He’s important to me.
I see.

Minoru is special to me, too.
Or he should be...

All right. I suppose I may have been too
hasty in my distress.

Out of respect for you and Takuma, I will
return for the time being.
Thanks, Falcomon.

(Looks like he came back.
But that doesn’t mean the ill will is gone.)

Minoru and Falcomon have built up a lot of
frustration after all we’ve been through.)
Then don’t believe.
I won’t force you to believe anything.
What’s that supposed to mean?

Terrible things are happening.
One mistake and we could be dead.

We don’t know how to deal with this, or who
or what’s even behind it.

If you’re really innocent, you’ll start to
earn our trust over time.
I’ve heard enough!

I’m the only one you’re really worried about.
I don’t have time for stubborn humans!

What?
Wait, Falcomon, hear me out!

You’re the stubborn one!
Get lost!
Minoru...
What should we do, Takuma?

Good question.
I don’t know what’s the right choice.

Seems like Minoru and Falcomon don’t know how
to get over their anxiety.

But we shouldn’t do anything rash until we’ve
figured things out!
I think you’re right!
Falcomon, wait!

What is it?
Come to hurl some more insults at me?

Can you at least wait until the professor
gets back before deciding? Please?

If you leave, we can’t protect each other.
It would be terrible if something happened!

All right. I suppose I may have been too
hasty in my distress.

Out of respect for you and Takuma, I will
return for the time being.
Thanks, Falcomon.
(Phew, I’m glad Falcomon is staying.)

(But he’s still keeping his distance.
Just like some of the others...)

(If only Minoru and Falcomon could get along
like Miu and Shakomon...)
